Energy the sequencing of how the conversation happens with devices is you
have devices that are broadcasting advertising their availability to connect and there are three channels that that happens on its 37 38 and 39
and the uber tooth only has one radio on it so it can only listen to any one of
those two to one of those channels at a time what it does then is it listens for
discover listens for advertise then it listens for a connect from something else in the Bluetooth protocol when a
connect happens they actually choose a channel at that moment and it won't be
one of those through advertising channels it'll be a different channel so the uber tooth listens to what's advertising the moment that anything
does a connect and it picks a channel the dash F
and the command line there is follow and it will follow that connection to
whatever other channel it went to and continue to pull that that connected
conversations data so in a noisy environment it's really difficult to
isolate a specific device and I haven't gotten into enough of the figuring out
all of the uber tooth stuff like I'm certain I could probably go into the code somewhere probably in parameters and specify it's these specific
identifiers that you need to follow but I just haven't gotten deep enough into it yet because in my house I only have
one device and it works so that's the one idiosyncrasy a solution to that is you can actually hook up three at one
time and you can specify 37 38 39 and now you will capture every single thing
that is advertising and you're you're sure then that you'll pick up the connect that occurs so if that's one of
the idiosyncrasies do you have to deal with is it's only gonna listen on one at a time and then it will follow whatever
connects on that so you have to sometimes specify listen on 38 37 39
